- Topic: Amending police code related to body-worn and in-car camera footage
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to amend sections of the police code to mandate prompt access to body-worn and in-car camera footage for arrestees or their legal counsel. It also prohibits NOPD leadership from authorizing deviation from any NOPD policy and entering into agreements exempting officers from NOPD policy. The ordinance was continued to the next meeting.
- Ordinance Number: 33018

    Vote 1: Continued - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 12/16/21.

- UID: 1aa7bfae-5c22-467a-b9e9-94af2d7942d3

- Topic: Amendments to ordinance related to police body-worn and in-car camera footage
- Summary: The amendments create an exception from the 30-day production requirement for footage that would compromise an investigation or endanger witnesses, pending Court authorization. It also removes the provision prohibiting NOPD from entering into agreements regarding exceptions to NOPD policy.
- Ordinance Number: N/A

- UID: 1aa7bfae-5c22-467a-b9e9-94af2d7942d3

- Topic: Amendment and reordainment of city code to grant enforcement and citation powers to certain city departments
- Summary: The ordinance aims to authorize the Superintendent of Police to grant enforcement and citation powers to employees of various city departments for the purpose of enforcing specific provisions of the city code.
